sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Liquid Manufacturing Vessel for preparation, mixing, and storage of liquid pharmaceutical formulations including solutions, syrups, and suspensions.
sections.scope: Applicable to liquid manufacturing activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the manufacturing vessel is clean and sanitized as per cleaning procedures.
Verify that all valves, ports, and connections are secure and leak-free.
Check that the mixer or agitator is properly installed and functional.
If equipped with heating or cooling jacket, verify utility connections.
Close all drain valves and sampling ports.
Measure and add purified water or solvent to the vessel.
Power ON the agitator and start mixing at low speed.
If heating is required, start the heating system and set temperature.
Monitor temperature using the temperature probe.
Add active ingredients in specified sequence while maintaining agitation.
Dissolve each ingredient completely before adding the next one.
Adjust pH if required using acid or alkali while monitoring with pH meter.
Add excipients including preservatives, sweeteners, and flavoring agents.
Continue mixing until uniform solution or suspension is achieved.
If cooling is required, circulate cooling water through the jacket.
Cool the product to desired temperature while maintaining agitation.
Take samples for quality control testing.
Verify appearance, pH, specific gravity, and other parameters.
Make volume up to final volume with purified water if required.
Mix thoroughly for final homogenization.
Transfer finished product through discharge valve for filling.
Clean the vessel, agitator, and all components immediately after discharge.
Document all manufacturing parameters, additions, and observations in the batch record.
precautions: Verify cleanliness of vessel before starting production.
Add ingredients in correct sequence to prevent incompatibilities.
Maintain proper temperature control for heat-sensitive ingredients.
Ensure complete dissolution before proceeding to next step.
Use calibrated equipment for volume and temperature measurements.
Prevent contamination by maintaining closed system.
Sample using aseptic technique for sterile products.
Clean vessel promptly to prevent material hardening.
Follow cleaning validation protocols for product changeover.
